com.github.vfro

Class Monitor<Entity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.vfro.Monitor<Entity>
  • Type Parameters:
    Entity - monitored entity type.

    public class Monitor<Entity>
extends Object
    Monitor is a synchronization construct that allows threads to have both thread-safe access to underlying monitored object or value (hereinafter monitored entity) and wait for it to mutate (if it is a mutable object) or change (if it is an immutable value) to a desirable state. 
     Monitor<Queue<String>> outputQueue =
    new Monitor<>(new LinkedList<String>());

 // ... monitoring thread
 while(true) {
    // wait for a new string in queue
    outputQueue.write(
       queue -> {
             System.out.println(queue.pull());

             // write access lambda must return its argument
             // to preserve reference to the queue
             return queue;
          },

       // wake up when the queue is not empty
       queue -> !queue.isEmpty()
    );
 }

 // ... somewhere in some other thread
 outputQueue.write(
    queue -> {
          queue.add("Hello Monitor!");
          return queue;
       }
 );

    • Constructor Detail

      • Monitor

        public Monitor(Entity entity)
        Create new instance of Monitor initialized by monitored entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - monitored entity.

      • Monitor

        protected Monitor(Entity entity,
                  Lock readLock,
                  Lock writeLock)
        Create new instance of Monitor initialized by an entity and custom locks. Custom locks must be re-entrant and support lock downgrading (Acquiring read lock inside write lock, and release write lock after that).
        Parameters:
        entity - monitored entity.
        readLock - Custom read lock.
        writeLock - Custom write lock. It may be the same instance as readLock.
        See Also:
        ReentrantReadWriteLock

      • read

        public final void read(Consumer<Entity> consumer,
                       Predicate<Entity> predicate)
                throws InterruptedException
        Wait for monitored entity to mutate or change to a desirable state and access it in shared mode.
        Parameters:
        consumer - access monitored entity. The consumer must not mutate monitored entity.
        predicate - a desirable state.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        read(java.util.function.Consumer), read(java.util.function.Consumer, java.util.function.Predicate, long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)

      • read

        public final boolean read(Consumer<Entity> consumer,
                          Predicate<Entity> predicate,
                          long time,
                          TimeUnit unit)
                   throws InterruptedException
        Wait for monitored entity to mutate or change to a desirable state and access it in shared mode.
        Parameters:
        consumer - access monitored entity. The consumer must not mutate monitored entity.
        predicate - a desirable state.
        time - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the time argument.
        Returns:
        true if the monitored entity has been accessed or false if the waiting time detectably elapsed before return from the method.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        read(java.util.function.Consumer), read(java.util.function.Consumer, java.util.function.Predicate)

      • write

        public final void write(Function<Entity,Entity> function)
        Access monitored entity in exclusive mode. Return value of function becomes new monitored entity.
        Parameters:
        function - exclusively access monitored entity. The function may mutate monitored entity or replace it with a new one.
        See Also:
        write(java.util.function.Function, java.util.function.Predicate), write(java.util.function.Function, java.util.function.Predicate, long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
